worksheet.title: PLC Outputs
worksheet.description: Understanding PLC output types and their applications

questions.question: What are the two main types of PLC outputs?

options.text: Low-current transistor outputs and high-current relay outputs

questions.correctAnswerText: Low-current transistor outputs and high-current relay outputs
questions.explanation: PLCs typically have two main output types: transistor outputs for low-current control signals and relay outputs for higher-current loads.

questions.question: What are transistor outputs best suited for?

options.text: Driving signals to other control devices

questions.correctAnswerText: Driving signals to other control devices
questions.explanation: Transistor outputs are ideal for sending control signals to other devices due to their fast switching and low current capabilities.

questions.question: Why are relay outputs preferred for driving loads like pumps and solenoids?

options.text: They are faster than transistor outputs
They are robust and can handle higher current

questions.correctAnswerText: They are robust and can handle higher current
questions.explanation: Relay outputs can handle higher currents and are more robust for driving inductive loads like pumps and solenoids.

questions.question: What is a key benefit of relays in control circuits?

options.text: They provide electrical isolation between control and power circuits
They eliminate the need for maintenance

questions.correctAnswerText: They provide electrical isolation between control and power circuits
questions.explanation: Relays provide galvanic isolation between the low-voltage control circuit and the higher-voltage power circuit, improving safety.

questions.question: What should you always check before connecting equipment to PLC outputs?
questions.explanation: Always verify that the equipment's voltage and current requirements match the PLC output specifications to prevent damage.

learningObjectives: Identify the two main types of PLC outputs
Understand when to use transistor vs relay outputs
Recognize safety considerations for PLC output connections
Apply knowledge of output ratings to equipment selection
